info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 12:52PM CDT until August 29 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, East Baton Rouge, Livingston and West Baton Rouge.
* WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1252 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Merrydale, Westminster, Inniswold, Brownfields, Gardere, Village St. George, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson and Baton Rouge Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge, LA; Livingston, LA; West Baton Rouge, LA
